name: clinker production | clinker | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20591/documentation

The dataset describes the production of Portland cement clinker. Clinker is made by sintering a mixture composed mainly of limestone and clay at temperatures up to 1400 °C.;The dataset is mainly based on sustainability reports of the two principal clinker producers of Peru (Pacasmayo and Unacem).

From the reception of traditional and alternative fuels and raw materials at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the cooling of the produced clinker. It includes the whole manufacturing process to produce clinker (raw material provision, grinding and mixing; rotary kiln process), internal processes (transport, etc.) and for the infrastructure only the rotary kiln (material consumption) is taken into account. No administration is included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The production volume of 2016 is considered. Data from sustainability reports of 2014 to 2017 is used. Not all the data for all exchanges was available for the same year, consequently the time period covers several years (the latest available is used).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Representative clinker production in Peru. Data based from main clinker producers.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This dataset represents the current technology for clinker production in Peru
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The life cycle inventory model is based on the PCR for cement and concrete(Environdec, 2010), as well as on the LCA core model of the WBCSD-CSI EPD tool (Dauriat et al., 2014). 
Air emissions (expect CO2, NOx and SO2) are modelled on literature values (Dauriat et al., 2014). The infrastructure, auxiliary materials, wastes are based on the global ecoinvent dataset for clinker production.

Standard basic uncertainty values were used.

Dauriat, A., Porté, C., Delerce, C., Guignard, C., & Adams, A. (2014). WBCSD CSI tool for EPDs of concrete and cement: LCA core model and database report.

Environdec. (2010). Product category rules of UN CPC 3744 Cement.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
The data is compiled based on different data sources, including sustainability reports, literature values and expert judgements. Most data is derived from sustainability reports of the two principal clinker producers of Peru (Pacasmayo and Unacem). The data is checked, completed and validated by local experts. In total, it is estimated that the data considered is representative for 68% of clinker production in all the country (market share of the three main clinker producers).
Unit flows were calculated by dividing the amounts of inputs and outputs by the total clinker production in mass.
The amount of the exchanges were calculated considering the arithmetic/weighted average of the sample. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other Ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Literature value. Water emitted to air refers to the water that is removed from the system and thus is not available for later use (CSI consumption indicator in litres per ton of cement). According to the sustainability reports the share of water consumed is about 79%.
Calculated value. Based on the wieghted average from the sustainability reports of Pacasmayo and Unacem. The LHV are taken from  (Dauriat et al., 2014)

exchanges.description: Estimated value. For Peru the same total amount of material input was assumed as for the global ecoinvent dataset (1.74kg of primary and secondary raw material per kg of clinker produced), given the limitation in data availability. The material composition is based on data from the Pacasmayo cement producer, representing 20% of the Peruvian market. The clinker composition in Peru (Pacasmayo, 2014) is 72% limestone, 15% clays, 2% iron oxide and 11% calcareous marl.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Values on NOx emissions from sustainability reports are used.

Calculated value. The values reported from the sustainability reports from Argos and Cemex from 2016 are used to extrapolate the average water withdrawal for cement and clinker production. The shares are calculated as following: surface water (67%), ground water (11%), tap water (9%), rain water (6%) and waste water (7%). Mathematical formula to calculate the value is:
water_withdrawal*80/100
